solution_line_template: The ratio between the time charged and the time to be charged is {full_charge_percentage} / {current_charge_percentage} = <<{full_charge_percentage}/{current_charge_percentage}={charge_ratio}>>{charge_ratio}.
To reach 100%, the cell must be charged for {initial_charge_time} minutes * {charge_ratio} = <<{initial_charge_time}*{charge_ratio}={total_charge_time_needed}>>{total_charge_time_needed} minutes.

Subtracting the {initial_charge_time} minutes that Jimmy already used to charge the cell phone, there are still {total_charge_time_needed} - {initial_charge_time} =<<{total_charge_time_needed}-{initial_charge_time}={remaining_charge_time}>>{remaining_charge_time} minutes of charging time left.
